physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Notable for many 3- to 4-mm firm, flesh-colored to pink, tender, dermal papules and an 8-mm nodule on the right extensor knee. Erythematous, tender, firm swellings at the distal tips of several toes. Pain evoked with passive movement of the wrists and elbows. Displayed flexion contractures of the elbows, restricted flexion and extension of the wrists, and inability to fully flex the fingers.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After 2 weeks of methotrexate, improvement noted in joint symptoms with further improvement and resolution in size of many cutaneous nodules at the 2-month follow-up. At 14 months post-treatment, regained all joint mobility and all cutaneous nodules had resolved.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Presented with a 5-month history of acute onset arthritis involving the hands and feet with decreased range of motion. Subsequently developed papules and nodules on the hands, feet, and elbows.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Despite treatment with NSAIDs, both cutaneous nodules and arthritis progressed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Approximately 10 firm, tender, somewhat symmetrical nodules without surface changes involving the palms and palmar proximal interphalangeal joints. Reticulate violaceous erythema on the back of hands and feet noted, improved in warmer climates (Raynaud phenomenon).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Polyarthritis managed with limited success despite several therapies, worsening with increased erosive changes seen in radiographs.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Displayed several firm, tender papules and subcutaneous nodules involving the scalp, forehead, periorbital areas, hands, and elbows. Noteworthy was leukopenia; a positive SSA antibody was observed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: One year after treatment with interferon-alfa and ribavirin, all cutaneous nodules and the indurated plaque on his neck had resolved, although an inability to fully flex the fingers was noted.
